intro: Duosperma clarae, commonly known as the brightstem milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by legume-like pods containing several seeds. Duosperma clarae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
